conclusion: To find the internal resistance of the silicon photocell when it is formed into a closed loop at a certain light intensity.
Line a represents the relationship between terminal voltage U and current I for the battery.
When I = 0, the terminal voltage equals the EMF of the battery.
At I = 0, the terminal voltage U is 3.6 V.
The EMF of the cell E = 3.6 V.
The intersection point between line a and line b gives the operating point of the circuit.
At the intersection, U = 2.5 V and I = 0.2 A.
The internal resistance r can be calculated using the formula: r = (E - U) / I.
Substitute the values: r = (3.6 V - 2.5 V) / 0.2 A.
The internal resistance of the silicon photocell at this light intensity is 5.5 Ω.
